stories.title: A National Vaccine Pass Has Quietly Rolled Out
Ukrainian guards may have survived reported last stand on Snake Island

stories.text:
There is a web page with the title "Russia MUST BE STOPPED! Help Ukraine WIN!" which appears to enable anyone to assist in a DDOS attack on a number Russian sites. I didn't post a direct link without text since participating in a DDOS attack is illegal, may violate your ISP's policies, etc. But I thought the HN community would be interested and perhaps have interesting things to say about it.

Here it is: https://stop-russian-desinformation.near.page/
stories.title: Russia Must Be Stopped Help Ukraine Win
You canâ€™t rebuild Wikipedia with crypto

stories.text:
I find myself zooming up to 150%, sometimes 175% on almost every website out there, HN included. Even my desktop graphic settings are set to 125% UI scale.

Small fonts make me less tired at the end of the day, as I spent a lot of time reading documentation and whatever.

I usually sit at 1 meter from my screen, but even when I use my laptop at 50cm from the screen, it's still too small.

I don't have a bad eyesight either, as I have no problem reading books, which have a good font size IMHO.

I was just wondering, how many people out there is like me, zooming everything to have an easier time reading.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why are fonts on websites so small?
